page.title: 20Farm Machinery at Newburgh
page.content: Farmers in this area need various types of machinery to farm the land.Much of the area is flat land with a few gentle slopes here and there.Quite often farmers find themselves ploughing up a good many stones in their fields which must be removed before machinery like Combine Harvesters can get to work. The soil around Newburgh is sandy so that the drainage is good where as at Tipperty the soil is heavy clay so there is poor drainage.The machines find the clay soil hard to work in,so the farmer uses double wheeled tractors.These tractors are used mainly for ploughing or planting. The most common machines are Combines and Tractors.The combines are used for cutting corn,wheat or barley.A tractor is used for pulling heavy machines.
